explanations.A: Rounding to the nearest 10 means choosing the number in the 10 times table that is closest to 43, so either 40 or 50. 43 is before the midpoint of the line, so it is closer to 40.
explanations.B: 45 is the closest point on the number line to 43, but we want the nearest 10. That means the nearest number that is in the 10 times table, so 40 or 50.
explanations.C: We want to choose the nearest 10 to 43. Picture where 43 is on this line. Is it before 45 or after? Anything that is before 45 will be closer to 40, anything from 45 onwards will be closer to 50.
explanations.D: Rounding to the nearest 10 means choosing the number in the 10 times table that is closest to 43, so either 40 or 50. Is 43 closer to 40 or 50?

explanations.A: You have multiplied by 10, but rounding means finding the closest number in the 10 times table. That will be either 70 or 80.
explanations.B: 75 is right in the middle of 70 and 80, but we have a rule that a number in the middle always rounds up, not down.
explanations.C: Rounding to the nearest 10 means choosing the number in the 10 times table that is closest to 75, so either 70 or 80. When we have a number that is right in the middle like 75, we always round up, so the "nearest 10" is 80.

explanations.A: 30 is the nearest ten, but we want the nearest hundred.
explanations.B: You have multiplied by 10, but rounding means finding the closest number in the 100 times table. That will be either 0 or 100.
explanations.C: You might have been confused because 26 is between 0 and 100, so you thought the nearest hundred had to be 100. But 0 still counts as a hundred when we are rounding, so which is 26 closer to, 0 or 100?
explanations.D: 26 is between 0 and 100, so rounding to the nearest hundred means choosing which of these it is closer to. 26 is closer to 0 than 100, so it rounds to 0.
